description.narrative: Combating Cyber Crime in Kosovo. Cybercrime has been defined by the European Commission as broad range of different criminal activities where computers and information systems are involved either as a primary tool or as a primary target.

condition.narrative: Social and environmental sustainability will be enhanced through application of the UNDP Social and Environmental Standards (http://www.undp.org/ses) and related Accountability Mechanism (http://www.undp.org/secu-srm).
UNDP as the Implementing Partner will comply with the policies, procedures and practices of the United Nations Security Management System (UNSMS.)

description.narrative: Number of trainings and personnel certified Number of officials of reached and informed about cyber security related issues Number of police, prosecutors and judges trained to protect critical information infrastructure (CII) and prevent and investigate cyber-crime; Increase capacity of CSI unit in KP Toolkit on digital forensic delivered Capacity increased in internet investigations in KP Capacity increased in darknet investigations in KP Reporting increased Human vigilance of general population increased and reporting increased with 25% Online reporting platform developed

comment.narrative: 100 cases reported No systematic training for employees and certified personnel limited knowledge of police, prosecutors and judges to protect critical information infrastructure (CII) and prevent and investigate cyber-crime; Basic knowledge of DCSI No toolkit available Limited capacity in internet and darknet in investigations Low reporting scale No systematic information for general public No reporting platform operational

- 118 Kosovo Police officials and over 100 prosecutors and judges gained knowledge on how to recognize cyber incidents, leading to improved skills on evidence collection, intelligence gathering online and darknet investigations; - The manual on cyber crime related issues was developed and distributed to judges and prosecutors into two local languages Albanian and Serbian; - One 30 min documentary on Cybercrime, titled “Internet (In)Security” was developed, produced, delivered and approved in three languages: Albanian, Serbian and English. The documentary featured cybersecurity experts, representative of the Kosovo Police, of the Chief State Prosecutor Office, representative of the civil society and one citizen who was victim of a cybercrime. The documentary also featured four designed info graphics containing statistics about cybercrime in Kosovo. See: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Ju51kE4jqs8&t=59s - 5 awareness videos developed: 1. General Awareness Video on Cyber Security, 2. Phishing Animation, 3. Children’s Safety on the Internet; 4. Animation Ransomware; 5. Animation Cyberbullying and Cyber VAWG. It was broadcasted online as part of the 16 days Campaign of Activism Against Gender Violence. https://www.facebook.com/UNDP.Kosovo/posts/4057862437562377 https://www.facebook.com/UNDP.Kosovo/photos/a.507218942626762/4769596649722282 https://www.facebook.com/UNDP.Kosovo/videos/395233975140587/ - “Ora 7” – on 6th May 2021, the morning show “Ora 7” in Klan Kosova was arranged for Mr. Mentor Cakolli (UNDP) to appear and talk about the “Careful on the Internet!” campaign; https://fb.watch/9ItRHY3HZe/ - Kosovo Cyber Challenge: https://undpkosovo.exposure.co/cyber-security-in-kosovo-in-hands-of-young-people - Digital solutions are of great importance to overcome network security challenges and strengthen the cybersecurity posture of an organization or institution. They can help mitigate security threats, spot ongoing attack attempts, detect suspicious user activities, and comply with regulatory mandates. Through Combating Cyber Crime in Kosovo (C3K) Project, the Agency for Information Society (ASHI) was supported with security information and event management (SIEM solution) that will proactively search for advanced security threats and detect and stop malicious activities. https://www.facebook.com/UNDP.Kosovo/posts/4931686290179983 - UNDP’s KSSP donated the Incident Response and Threat Intelligence Platform for KOS-CERT that is virtualized server platform that enabled Central CERT to collect, detect and analyze threats from 3rd party external threat feeds, specifically with focus on Kosovo Internet Service Providers, as well as identify and characterize ongoing and emerging Internet threat behaviors using threat sharing platform, generate reports and escalate incidents to relevant stakeholders. https://www.facebook.com/UNDP.Kosovo/posts/3747827051899252 - Due to COVID-19 pandemic, the conference has taken place online, which also made it possible to open it up to international audience. It was carried it out into two full days as listed below: ▪ Virtual International Conference: Cybersecurity Threats Landscape, new trends and modes of cooperation, 20 October 2021 ▪ Virtual International Conference: Combating Cybercrime: Risks, Challenges and Legal response, 21 October 2021. https://www.facebook.com/UNDP.Kosovo/videos/3368645769855515/ https://www.facebook.com/UNDP.Kosovo/posts/4046376205377667
